availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. G. Roberts (lawyer and notary, pendleton county)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney, public notary, and soldier. Kentucky native. Attorney in Pendleton County in 1860. Captain in the 5th Kentucky Brigade of Confederate Infantry. Public notary in Pendleton County in 1861.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton county, Falmouth p. 7. Memorial History of Louisville from Its First Settlement to the year 1896, Josiah Stoddard Johnston, ed., vol. 1(Chicago: American Biographical Publishing Co., 1896), 209. KYR-0001-020-1462.
